trends: There have been 11 other sightings in Sheffield
There were no other sightings in Sheffield on or around June 1st 2009
Summary: Repeated appearance and dissapearance of floating flashing object.
divs: Sighting DetailsTime - 22:00 exactly Its a hot summers evening, still light amidst the recent weekends heatwave. Im sat by my computer typing this exactly as it happens. As i sit here in my studio on the mufon website, i look out of my window to see a extremely bright light over a nearby hill visible between the houses of the cul-de-sac. When i first see the light i automatically think of the reasonably and rational things it could be, a flare, a plane. After the light hovered, moved slightly to the left, then faded away i put it down to being an aircraft. This was about 9:50 when the first sighting occured. in the 10 minutes i have been away from the computer since i began typing this, i dont know if it has returned however all i know is when i got back i looked and the light was there once more, glowing bright and fading within a 20 second timespan. If it werent for the second encounter of this unknown phenomeneon i would not be typing this now, however i have scanned this website and the detail matches similar case of floating lights also spotted in sheffield however slightly further away from my current destination. NOTE>< the light has just returned as i am typing this, exactly the same, appearing and fading. As i was saying it matches the description of someone elses sheffield sighting in which a series of floating lights hovered and flew over theri house. I dont know if these lights will return. However i have an exam in the morning and i need sleep. To finish. everytime i saw the floating light i felt a strange awe and aura, almost as if time had stopped for a breif second NOTE another sighting, howevber this time one floated sidewards and another came into visibility. this is creepy now. i will post another file if this sighting contunues tomorow. i cant take a photo. my phone wont pick up the light as it is too far away. however i wouldnt have typed all this if i had seen nothing. End.
